result.execSummary:
The defendant MALACHI U. ALLEN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay all fees and costs.
Follow all rules of department.
Counseling as deemed appropriate including COMPAS assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Provide DNA sample and fingerprint if not previously submitted. 
4 days credit if revoked.
Defendant shall pay in full all costs, fines, and/or restitution prior to discharge of supervision and no further criminal law violations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
